simplesect.para:
When you choose the menu item
Edit Axes...
, the dialog shown below will appear. In this dialog you can configure all options which are related to the axes. The dialog contains 4 tab sheets. The first sheet, shown below, contains options for the x-axis. The tab with options for the y-axis is completely analog to this.

listitem.para: This is the lowest value on the axis. Default: -10
This is the highest value on the axis. Default: 10

This is the distance between the tick marks on the axis. Tick marks are shown as small lines perpendicular to the axis. Tick unit is used for both tick marks and for showing numbers. With a logarithmic axis the Tick unit indicates the factor between the markers. For example a Tick unit for 4 will show 1, 4, 16, 64, etc. on a logarithmic axis while it will show 0, 4, 8, 12, etc. on a normal axis.
This is the distance between the gridlines perpendicular to the axis. This is only used if grid lines are shown.
Check this field if you want the axis to be scaled logarithmically.
When this field is checked numbers are shown on the axis with the distance chosen under Tick unit.

When this field is checked, the text in the edit box will be shown just above the x-axis in the right side of the coordinate system. For the y-axis, the text will be shown at the top to the right of the axis. You may use this to show what unit is used for the axes.

varlistentry.term: The x-axis crosses at / The y-axis crosses at:

listitem.para: This is the coordinate where the axis will cross the other axis. This is only used when Axes style is Crossed. Default: 0
When checked the program will choose a value for Tick unit that is fitting for the axes dimensions and size of the window.
When checked, Grid unit will have the same value as Tick unit.
When this field is checked tick marks are shown as small lines on the axis with the distance chosen under Tick unit.
When this field is marked grid lines will be shown as dotted lines perpendicular to the axes with the color chosen under Font and color and with the distance chosen at Grid unit.

varlistentry.term: Show as a multiple of pi:

listitem.para: When this is enabled the numbers on the axis are shown as fractions multiplied by &pgr;, for example 3&pgr;/2. Show numbers must be enabled for this option to be available.
